campaign.story:
I recently went into Compass Studios in Nashville and recorded my first instrumental record, "Crickets".  The title has personal meaning for me, but it is just a clever way of saying "without a word".   
TO BE HONEST, I didn't mean to make an instrumental record, never mind a jazz album.  I just had the itch to record with some friends.  I'm not a trained musician, but whenever I sit down to play the piano, something like jazz happens.   When I played some of this music for a few intimate friends, the response was unanimous- "This music needs to be heard".  
SO, HERE IT IS- "CRICKETS"!
The band is smoking on these 10 self penned songs, and I'm excited to share the music with my fans, old and new.  All backers will receive the digital download before Christmas!  
The record is finished, but I need to pay costs of manufacturing and marketing, and that's where you, the listener, come in.  Most of you know the drill- this is how we get a lot of our music these days, and I'm so grateful for the opportunity to work with you to get my music in your hands.  $10,000 is the bare minimum to meet most of my expenses, and I'm happy to say we have met that goal.
So here are the "STRETCH GOALS",  which need to be met by December 14th, less than two weeks away:
At $15,000 EVERYONE will receive a free download EP of me playing Holiday songs on piano- funky, jazzy, heartfelt renditions that no one has ever heard!  
Mercyland: Hymns For The Rest Of Us, Volume One
At $20,000, EVERYONE will receive "Mercyland: Hymns For The Rest Of Us" Volume 1, which includes Emmylou Harris, Buddy Miller, John Scofield, CIndy Morgan, Mat Kearney, North Mississippi Allstars, Shawn Mullins, and more!  (At $20k, digital only backers will receive a download of Mercyland; physical backers will receive the CD and the download!).
I've got backer rewards that have been popular in past campaigns- a limited edition T shirt, my hand-painted postcards, songwriting sessions, CDs, Vinyl, and more.  But the most exciting thing to me is the music.  Long after your T shirt gets worn out, these grooves will keep spinning.  
Thanks for your support!Meanwhile, below you can see some postcards I've painted that exemplify the span of ideas if you wish to order the custom painting from me.
Phil's handpainted postcards
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my 5th Kickstarter campaign. My pledge is to get the products to backers before the various deadlines, but this is not a guarantee. I'll do my best to get everything manufactured and into the backers' hands in a timely fashion. Being a human endeavor from manufacturing to mailing, we may hit a snag here or there, but all rewards will be delivered.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey Friends!  
Yesterday, I went into Sound Emporium with most of the players from "Crickets"-  Rahsaan Barber, Chris Donohue, James Hollihan, and Aaron Smith, along with a production crew- my stalwart engineer Sean Sullivan, his assistant Rachel, and my dear friend Sirkka Svanoe Wood, who has quietly guided this project and who painted the cover of "Crickets".

Please fill out your survey ASAP- I cannot order T-shirts until I have everyone’s size. Thanks so much and have a great week!

campaign.story:
I thought I was done making records. 
I felt I had said all I'd ever have to say. Then life happened. 
The past few years have felt like wandering in the desert, in a myriad of ways. I had to face some hard truths about myself and ask some hard questions, about who I am, what I believe, and what I'm called to do.
These questions led to my podcast, The Pivot, which has been a real joy to produce. It also led to this new project, "The Painted Desert".
"The Painted Desert" is, I pray, the album version of conversation with a friend where you have the freedom to be real with doubt, fear AND hope.
I wanted this record to be beautiful. I wanted it to have space for listeners to think, feel, and remember.
This is absolutely my favorite thing I've ever done and I'm so very excited for you to hear it.
I'm also excited that streaming and social media can allow my music to reach new people. That's why the funds raised here on Kickstarter, after they pay the folks who worked on the record, will go towards marketing and playlist promotion. I really want as many people as possible to get to hear these songs.
"The Painted Desert" will officially release in its entirety in October. I'll put songs out on Spotify and iTunes one or two at a time, so that I can tell the story of the record throughout the year, not just release week. 
That means THIS WILL BE THE ONLY TIME to get the full record for a while. (Unless you come to one of my shows.)
My last Kickstarter took a lot longer to complete than anticipated, and I hated that feeling. That's why this time the record is done beforehand. Support today and you'll get an immediate download of the album. CDs, hats, books and such will all be made as soon as the Kickstarter is done so you'll get the rewards quickly, as well.
Deep thanks to the amazing people who have already worked on this project: Shane Wilson, Josh and Becca Wilson, Joe Causey, Zach McNair, Paul Eckberg, Laura Preston, Kim Fisher, Randall and Amy Goodgame, Jeremy Casella, Nathan Johnson, Cason Cooley, Greg LaFollette, Russ Ramsey, Chris & Jenna Badeker (Wild Harbors), and most wonderfully, my wife and daughters. These are amazing people whose work on the record was a real gift.
I'm so proud of this project and so thankful to have had the opportunity to make it. It feels special to me and I hope it connects with you in a unique and helpful way.
Thanks for checking this out and for your support. You guys are awesome!
                         *(Yes, we changed the cover art after I made these reward tier images!)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The record is finished, so there won't be any hiccups getting that to you!

As you know, Kickstarter is all or nothing, so not getting funded would obviously be pretty rough. 

Other than that, I've tried to do everything possible to make this go around as simple and ready-to-go as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey everybody! I wanted to give you a quick update about the rewards for “The Painted Desert” - The CDs are being made, book is being designed and the B-Side’s EP is coming along nicely.
This morning I walked down to the A room of the Art House, where I’ve recently moved into a new Studio, and Evan and I recorded the bulk of the acoustic version of the album we reached as a stretch goal. I’ll invite some guests to join me on a few songs and then get this out to you, as well.

updates.update_userinfo: What song would you like handwritten lyrics of?
updates.update_content:
Thank you everyone, for your support of such a successful campaign. It has gone so well and I'm so thankful. There are FOUR DAYS LEFT before "The Painted Desert" goes in the vault for a while. If you'd like to share the link and encourage folks to support the album, that would be greatly appreciated!
http://kck.st/2DcAfoM
Also, if we can raise another 2k, getting us to $22,000, I'll add an acoustic version of the entire record, with some special guest harmony vocals. It will be a lot of fun.

campaign.story:
If you are just discovering Dan Russell and his music through Kickstarter we invite you to stop by his new website www.danrussellmusic.net which will be live by May of 2017, or visit his Facebook Artist Page or Instagram. Dan will be performing live later in 2017 and 2018.

We Made It
Thank you everyone for joining and backing me in this campaign. I'm looking forward to sharing the music with you all later this year. Just a reminder for those of you who backed the campaign to please check the updates section for backers only and download a couple of the songs from the forthcoming album when ever you have a chance. I am so grateful and offer my sincerest thanks. 
New to the Campaign- Hear a Song from the album:
Listen to Let You Be Mine, a new song from my album by clicking on the image below:
About Me
My story is probably not much different than many of those who have worked closely in the music and film industry. I started with a love for music, guitar, songs and playing in bands through High School and College, and somewhere along the way got drawn into helping some wonderful artists and friends bring their music to the world. 

Some of you know me as an artist manager and advocate, a concert promoter, a record producer, or possibly as the co-founder of The Soulfest (New England), Fingerprint Records, New Sound International, or perhaps to some of you I’m just another Harley Davidson rider.

Over the past 35 years, I’ve had the honor, privilege, and good fortune to work closely with many inspiring artists, including the late Michael Been and Mark Heard, as well as The Call, U2, Black Rebel Motorcycle Club, Sam Phillips, Vigilantes of Love, Bruce Cockburn, Switchfoot, Ramona Silver, Rachel Taylor, The Violet Burning and many others.
I grew up in a home surrounded by and filled with music. Music brought life into focus and was the primary way I related to my family, my friends, and to my world.

When I was about 13 years old I started playing the drums on a classic Ludwig drum kit, which I traded to one of the guitar players in a High School band. I took a few lessons on guitar to learn the songs everyone at my school wanted to hear and that’s where my foundation was poured. The Rolling Stones, Allman Brothers, Dylan, Stevie Ray Vaughan, Eric Clapton, Led Zeppelin, The Clash, The Band, Neil Young and so many others.

In College, going to shows and seeing every new band that came through Boston or anywhere close, was my number one priority. So many shows had a powerful impact on me.  As one thing led to another I worked in various support capacities with more artists then I can remember, but essentially ended up touring throughout the world and experienced first hand how powerful music impacted and changed lives.
Some artists asked me to help with tour management, others with record production and a few with career management. Putting my own musical and artistic dreams aside, I worked for and with artists that impacted me deeply which motivated me to share my experience and their music with the world. 
Recently I decided to work less on the business side of music and to start writing songs again. With my son, Jesse’s encouragement, along with the rest of my family and a new friend, Michael Pritzl, I decided to record a few old songs, finish some new ideas and make an album.
Life has been a big circle for me, but here I am ready to complete something I intended to do many many years ago. I hope that you’ll consider helping me complete this circle of mine. I love music, and I love the power it has to share our stories, convey our truths and change our lives, and it would mean more than I could properly express, to have you help me make this dream a reality. 
I’ll be sharing more stories as we go, here on Kickstarter and to whatever extent you can, I deeply appreciate your participation and support. I welcome you to become a part of my story and help me make this album come to life.

I'm looking forward to sharing this music with all of you. Thanks for your support!  ~Dan

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with all Kickstarter campaigns, the biggest challenge is the prospect of not reaching our financial goal. We are ready to meet our reward obligations, but I need your help to make this happen. Funds raised over and above our goal will be used to help with production on the new record and help to cover the costs of artwork, mastering, and manufacturing. As always, I thank you for your support.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
CLARA'S GHOST 
A middle-aged homemaker contending for attention within her ego-obsessed show-biz family struggles to maintain her grasp on reality. This film explores the toxic side effects of the entertainment industry within the family structure set against the backdrop of a classic New England ghost story.
Set over the course of a single evening at the Reynolds’ Family home in suburban Connecticut, Clara’s Ghost tells the story of Clara Reynolds who, fed up with constant ribbing from her self-centered showbiz family, finds solace in and guidance from the supernatural force she believes is haunting her. 
The Elliott Family home and our filming location
Starring Chris, Abby, Bridey, and their mom Paula Elliott in the lead roles and to be shot on location at their home in Old Lyme, Connecticut, Clara’s Ghost offers fictionalized but personal insight into one of America’s favorite comedy dynasties. When you think of the Elliotts, you think: wacky, attractive, wealthy, successful, but you never think: sad, bitter, alcoholic, egomaniacs... or do you? 
Abby, Bridey, their grandfather Bob, and Chris
A NOTE FROM THE DIRECTOR 
This film is about family. It’s about our capacity to love and understand each other while reconciling the inevitable alienation that sets in as families grow up. My parents have been empty nesters for almost ten years now, my sister will soon be starting her own family, and I, well I’m not there yet, but I do have a cat. We are on our own journeys. 
Yes, this is my real family, in our real home, but we are playing characters…or caricatures of ourselves. Clara’s Ghost takes place in one night in our family home. It’s a drunken hullaballoo of an evening set against the backdrop of a traditional New England ghost story that explores the traps set by familial love–the ways that unconditional attachment and intimacy can restrict us as well as set us free. The goal of casting my family and filming at our house is to bring you into the fold. I want you to feel like you are really hanging out with us, experiencing the comfortable claustrophobia that is intrinsic in being a member of the Elliott Family, the Reynolds Family, or any family really.
PLAY

Chris & Paula on Letterman in '86 (edited)
WHO ARE WE? 
The Elliott Family has been doing comedy on TV since the 1950s. Starting with Bob Elliott, who was a prolific radio and TV star with his comedy partner, Ray Goulding. Bob and Ray had their own Broadway show, as well as their own show on NBC. Chris, Bob's son, was a tour guide in Rockefeller Center when David Letterman walked into the elevator where Chris was conducting his tour. Naturally, he hammed it up for Letterman and was soon writing and performing on “Late Night with David Letterman”. Also working on the show was Paula, a talent coordinator with a great set of gams. Soon the two were married, Paula quit her job and on the night that Letterman won an Emmy, their first child Abby was conceived. Three years later, Bridey, was born and the Elliott family foursome was complete. All having fought depression at one point or another, there were as many dark times as there were happy times growing up, but this only drew the family closer. As a result their sense of humor became stronger... but not smarter. To be clear, the Elliotts are not smart. If you're looking for smart, they're not right for you.
Like the Barrymores or the Baldwins or the Obamas, The Elliotts are a family of talent and style that America looks up to, but doesn't necessarily understand just how TALENTED they really are. Clara's Ghost will finally give the family a platform and voice to whine about Hollywood, and to collect your accolades for doing so.
Bridey Elliott (writer/director) and Sarah Winshall (Producer) first met when they were two of the only female clerks working at Kim’s Video & Music, New York City’s most beloved video store. When both of them relocated to Los Angeles, they teamed up to create their first short film, a microbudget, character-driven comedy, Affections. The film premiered at the 2016 Sundance Film Festival and gained popularity as it played at several other film festivals nationally and internationally. It was released theatrically as part of the Sundance Shorts Tour in June of 2016, screened on the Opening Night of the Maryland Film Festival, received the Best Short Film award from the International Film Festival of Boston and the Jury Award for Best Short Film from the South Dakota Film Festival. Affections premiered online at NoBudge.com in November 2016. Clara’s Ghost is their next collaboration. 
PLAY

What people thought of Affections:
“Writer/director/star Bridey Elliott is a triple threat in this intentionally cringe-worthy comedy about a lonely and desperate young woman adrift in the City of Angels.” –indieWIRE
“a beautifully bittersweet comedy.” –The Moveable Fest
“a lighthearted [film] that finds unexpected emotional weight” –Filmmaker Magazine
"Affections is a soft-spoken musing on isolation in the modern age...This is a really beautiful film... Keep your eyes and ears open for more from Bridey Elliott, she’s the real deal and primed to breakthrough." -Film School Rejects
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Filmmaking is by nature collaborative, and involves a lot of moving parts. But by keeping our budget modest, our cast & crew populated with trusted friends & family, and hitting the ground running to make this film, we hope to minimize those risks and rise to the challenge. 

As a team we are used to working quickly with minimal means. In fact, we thrive on these restrictions! Our first film together, the short comedy "Affections", was made on a microbudget of $3,000. That went on to premiere at the 2016 Sundance Film Festival. If we can do a 16 minute short for $3,000, we can do a 90 minute thriller-comedy for $300,000+...

Every feature film presents a certain degree of risk and challenges. This is, for us, an especially exciting and scary prospect. It is our first feature film, and aside from the fear that "Clara's Ghost" will haunt our set, we also are challenged by our compulsion to make this movie be the best movie it can be. We are lucky to have a cast of seasoned actors who are so reliably talented and with invaluable advice. We will inevitably rely on their vast experience to help guide us through the unknown.

Additionally, we are lucky to have YOU, our fans. Your impeccable sense of humor and excellent taste won't falter. YOU hold us accountable to make the funniest, nuttiest, most sensitive ode to Clara we can. And with your support, we will! And of course, as we roll along, we'll keep all you posted with the latest news. If we hit any snags, we'll let you know. But you can be assured that we WILL make this movie, no matter what. We HAVE to.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello beautiful backers!
First off, let me, this is Bridey, express my gratitude to you all- I know we've been quiet on  the Kickstarter page since the whole Sundance dance. It's been a whirlwind for the whole CG team and I know we are behind in the estimated delivery schedule of rewards such as the digital download, voice mails, and the house tour. Please rest assured those will come as soon as humanly possible. As first time feature filmmakers we could not foresee all that happens after the festival premiere. (Good things!)---( Doesn't that sound like something Trump would tweet?) But these good things have complicated and delayed these rewards. I apologize for that and appreciate your patience, and will let you all know when to expect these rewards as soon as we can. Does anyone want more brownies or underpants in the mean time??

Dearest Friends, Family, Ghost lovers,
You may have been wondering -- where have we been? Does Clara's Ghost even exist? Why did I support this film if they never even post updates?
Well... it's been quiet on the homefront because we've been working hard to finish the film to get ready for our WORLD PREMIERE at the 2018 Sundance Film Festival!

Hello Ghostly supporters! 
We are about to start day 5 of shooting! It's been really wonderful so far. I think you might like this movie when it's ready for viewing.

updates.update_userinfo: 5 Days of Shooting, and some fruity undertones
updates.update_content:
Hello Clara’s Ghost-ers! 
Greetings from me, Bridey, how are you all doing? Did you guys like the eclipse? Or were you sad the Mets lost? Who knows what any of it means any ways. All I know is, we are shooting this goddamn movie in four weeks whether you like it or not and I hope you like it because you are why and how we are making it. I am already settled at my folks house in Connecticut, usually I’d feel like a big fat loser right now, but now I get to say “No, I’m not here to free load at my parents house, and hit on the cashiers at Stop and Shop. I am here to make a movie.” Pre-production starts in a week and that means all of our fabulous crew from Los Angeles will say “Goodbye city life, Green acres, here we come!” and join me in the woods of Connecticut until early October.

updates.update_userinfo: Update from the 'burbs AKA we're actually making this thing!

campaign.story:
6/24/16 ~ We hit our goal!  Thank you...and now a word from Derri...and Chris Taylor on stretch goals!
So here's how this works: If we hit $25k before the end of the campaign, everyone will receive a bonus ambient instrumental mix of the new album. This means if you pledge for a download or vinyl/download level, you'll receive the bonus ambient mix album via download as well. (We won't be pressing the ambient mix on vinyl.) If you pledge on any level that includes a CD, the ambient mix of the album will be included on CD with your order.
If we hit 30k before the end of the campaign, in addition to the ambient mix, everyone will receive a bonus album of covers, chosen by the fans that have pledged in the "Song O' Matic" level of this campaign. This also means if you pledge for a download or vinyl/download level, you'll receive the bonus covers album via download as well. (We won't be pressing the covers album on vinyl.) If you pledge on any level that includes a CD, the covers album will be included on CD with your order.
Let's see if we can hit those stretch goals before the project wraps on June 30th!
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
When you start a record you have ideas floating around in your head about what it might sound like. I’m a dreamer. I tend to think in terms of color, space and sound. Lyrical adventures that transport people to another place and time. Whenever Steve Hindalong and I would start a Choir record we would talk about what kind of record we wanted to make. I would go on about this kind of sound, that kind of vibe, and at some point Steve would always look at me and say,  “Shouldn’t we write the songs first?” Of course he was right. When I talked to Steve about this record his response was “This needs to be your voice. Your stories.” So I’m going to bring in my great songwriter friends and share my stories with you. I can’t really say what kind of record it will be in the end but I’m going to share my heart with you. I can tell you it will have a lot of moody guitars! And I can tell you that I’ll give you my best. I’m looking forward to all of you hearing it and sharing this journey with me. ~ Derri
My guess is you have questions. Hopefully we have answers....
Will you be releasing the album on vinyl? ~ Yes, we will be pressing 250 copies of the album on 180g vinyl.  150 copies will be black, and 100 will be color. (Color tba.)  This is a one time pressing.
What kind/size of T-Shirts are being used in the campaign? ~ For this campaign, our manufacturer will use pre-shrunk, 100% cotton, heavyweight Fruit Of The Loom shirts in mens sizes Small through 5XL. We will also produce the design on "Ladies Cut" t-shirts in sizes X-Small through 2XL.
If we meet the goal, how long will it be before I get my order? ~ Great question. The moment we reach goal (assuming we do), everything will go into production. Our projected schedule is that Derri will turn in a finished record in December of this year, and everything will be manufactured and shipped by April of 2017.  He will be recording the album primarily in Southern California (vs his studio in Nashville) while he also cares for his Dad, and he believes this setup will allow him to meet recording deadlines.  Whatever the wait time, we promise it will be worth it.
Is there a photo of the guitar being offered from Derri's collection? ~ 
Fender Starcaster
Let's make this happen....

updates.update_content:
Hey friends ~ I wanted to share a note about a project I think you'll all want to get behind involving the late Mark Heard.
I first spoke with Mark on the phone. It was a short conversation. I was singing one of his songs, “Two Trusting Jesus” at a wedding that evening. I couldn’t find the lyric or my vinyl record. I talked to someone at our booking agency, which was also Mark’s, to give me his phone number. His wife Janet picked up the phone and I asked if I could speak to Mark. After about 30 seconds he came to the phone. I explained my situation and asked if he could read me the lyrics so I could write them down. Dumb thing to ask! He was silent for a minute and then I heard him say “Janet some guy wants me to read a lyric to him. Can you do it?” He then handed the phone to Janet who kindly read me the lyric.

The Time Has Come Tour with The Choir & Michael Roe
Tour dates, cities and ticket information at  www.thechoir.net/tour 
A quick note from The Choir.
We kick off our tour this Friday March 8th in Alabama and we’re happy to be back on the road!

updates.update_content:
Quick update -

Sincere thanks to each and every one of you for getting The Lost Dogs to our $25K goal with time to spare. We'd like to use that time to attempt to hit a stretch goal. If we hit $30K before the campaign closes at midnight (central) on Friday 11/30, anyone that has pledged for VINYL will receive a limited edition (no more than 500 pressed) bonus 7" featuring the bonus track "The Good Ship Lollipop" on the A Side, and a previously unreleased Lost Dogs track from the era on the B Side. Those of you pledging for the deluxe download or CD will receive these tracks as part of their download and/or deluxe CD. *The B Side will be either a previously unreleased demo, rough mix, or live track from the era.*

campaign.story:
It begins here.
I wanted to create a 'kid's book' for both children and adults to read together. It's the adventures of a bear named "Stuffed" and his animal friends. Each page is a simple joke just to make the reader smile.
I've wanted to take on a project like this and put my energy towards showing not only myself, but family and friends, that with hard work and support, you can create this fun book.
The challenge.
I have a full time job, so in my spare time I am still drawing cartoons to make it into this new book.  I have set a goal of one cartoon a day, I'm more than halfway there. 
Nuts and bolts.
I want to produce 500 Hardcover (7x7) black and white books.  But, if all the incentives sell, we can print even more books. I will be using printninja.com for my printing and am looking forward to that process.  There will be proofs, corrections, more proofs, deadlines, and layout work still to happen. This will be a great experience for all of us. 
Close family and friends have encouraged me to take my doodles to the next level, and so this book is a great next step to share with you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenges in front of me are 2 things: Artwork & Printing

I am committed to doing at least one drawing a day to finish this book in time so that should be right on track. 

Printing is going to be fun because I've never done it before. SO I'm figuring that out. I will be using printninja.com for printing and all SHOULD go well, but there can always be challenges that show up. 

I am committed to getting this finished & out by the end of September 2016. I will do everything I can to make that goal.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: THE END IS HERE...OR IS IT?
updates.update_content:
Well friends,...every single kickstarter-partner package has been sent!  Now, we wait and see if everyone gets their goodies.  I've had a few people tell me they are still waiting for "Stuffed" but some other folks said that the mail has been really slow as of late.
You can always let me know if you haven't seen anything yet, (coreymann0818@gmail.com) and just a quick update - I'm already working on Book #2 for 2017!
Thanks again!
The Stuffed bears arrived that week! We are getting even closer to the finished product.

Tonight, we got to work on words, font choices, jokes, picture sizes, etc. Also, the Stuffed Bear was ordered...& and I realized I forgot to get myself one! I'll have to get a photo with one of your "limited edition" bears! I'm still targeting September!

Hi friends!  I just sent out a 'survey' that is basically asking for your mailing address info, (and for some of you - a shirt size too).  Get that info survey back to me when you can.  We have a little ways to go but we are just working ahead.
Thanks!
Corey

Last night as we watched the time count down on Kickstarter, not only did you help us meet goal, but go above and beyond! As of right now, the art is getting scanned into a computer and then we'll add words to the page. You'll probably get contacted soon about your "pledge" and it's that backing that truly helped us get to this step in the project. I'll keep you in the loop every step of the way.
Thanks again.

I used that title so that amazing keyboard part of Europe's song would be playing in your head. My friend Adam has all the drawings and has begun scanning them. Then we will add words, and then some sort of order arrangement for the book. Thanks again for your support. Also, I'm back to drawing other things as well, you can see that on Instagram "corey818".

It seems like a lifetime ago that we launched this project.  Then we hit our original goal in just 4 days!  Now, we are just ending strong with an 'above and beyond' finish.  Thanks to those who have given, and to those who haven't.....well, please don't make me suffer for 7 days by staying up all night watching our page.....pretty please!

This past weekend, I finally put the pencil and pen down and finished the final cartoon panel for "Stuffed: Bear Minimum".  It's been fun and challenging coming up with the humor and visual to go with it.
We are at the halfway mark of the project, and although we've met goal, we are still pushing forward to print even more books, hopefully copyright the character(s) and a  number on the back of the book to help with future bookstore possibilities, (all of which costs money!)

Saturday morning - it's early, and I'm almost done with the original drawings. I usually watch West Wing on Netflix, or some music. I have to watch my right hand carefully because it sometimes smears the fresh ink & then do-over. I went a little overboard on an astronaut joke...just a little preview.

campaign.story:
It has been over three years since I released my first musical project, Art From The Ashes EP. This has been three years of growth, change, and a whole lot of life experience. I have wrestled with fear, self-doubt, and writer's block, but I have come to the other side with music that I can't wait to share. 
The most prominent lesson that God has taught me in this time is that his love and grace are more rich, vibrant, and colorful than I could ever imagine. 
From that truth comes The Color EP. 
I have never been more eager and excited to share songs before, and I need your partnership to make it happen. 
Here is what you can do. 
1. Check out all the packages under the "rewards" tab. Give as much as you want to give, and I will send you some pretty special things in return. More info below!  
2. Make your pledge by clicking the green "Back This Project" button at the top-right. You won't be charged until the project is completed. 
THIS IS ALL OR NOTHING. If I raise all $7,000 in 30 days, I get to make this project, you get to hear it, and we all walk away winners! If I raise any amount short of that goal, your credit card is never charged, and I never see a penny. 
What are you supporting? 
The Color EP is a 5 song project. 5 songs that I have written with other wonderful songwriters who are also dear friends. 5 songs that represent universal truths that God has taught me in recent months. 5 songs that I can't wait to share. 
Stylistically, this has elements of the acoustic, quirky vibe from my first EP. But this project is more mature, more developed, more sonically interesting, and more pop. 
It is being produced by the talented Seth Penn. Seth and I have written together many times over the years, and he brings amazing creativity to the music. He is able to take the ideas in my head and make them sound even better than I imagine. 
What do I need? 
I need $7,000 to create this album. Here is the breakdown. 
Production = $4,200. This goes to pay my producer, studio time, musicians, mixing and mastering. 
Artwork/Design - $100 
CD Printing: $500 
Kickstarter cost & fees: $600
Rewards: $600
Marketing/publicity: $1,000
$7,000 is the base number. The bare minimum to make this happen. If we can raise even more, we will get to do even more! 
Stretch goal #1: $8,500 
$8,500 will allow us to hire a publicist and really get the word out to more people. I would love to make this happen! 
Stretch goal #2: $10,000 
$10,000 would allow us to make some awesome video content! And this benefits YOU, too! 
We are already halfway through with the recording process. We have finished pre-production and some of the instrument tracking. Your funds are needed to finish this out and make it a reality! 
When is this happening?
The EP is scheduled to release late January or early February. More details will be coming soon! 
 What are the rewards? 
For full reward details, check out the "Rewards" tab. But here are a few more details on some of the fun things you could get for your donation! 
It starts at just 5 little dollars. You can receive anything from an early download of the full album to a signed physical copy of the CD to exclusive "bonus demo" content to some fun merch items. 
Check out the beautiful cover of the new EP. All photography by Sydney Goodwin Photography (www.sydneygoodwinphotography.com)
One of the items you could receive is an art print of one of the lyrics to my song "Fight Your Fear." 
It's an overlay of my own handwriting and a beautiful photo taken by the talented Madeleine Bonin (www.madeleinebonin.com). 
You could also get a The Color EP mug. Photo coming soon! 
Huge shoutout to Kate Allen (www.uncommonkate.com) for helping me design the cover art, art print, and mug. 
In Closing...
Thank you in advance for every bit of support on this project. Every bit means so much to me. 
I also ask that you pray for us as we continue to make this music. Pray that God will use these songs to affect someone in some way. 
For more information about me and my music, visit: 
My website 
Facebook
Instagram 
Twitter

campaign.story:
For years artists, particularly Christian artists, have struggled to connect with audiences beyond their music. This podcast will be an avenue for just that. Armed with almost a decade of sitting down and chatting it up with artists, Ben Milton has a unique relationship and perspective on the business and ministry.
Phase 1 funds the startup costs of the podcast. We are talking mics, digital recorder and hosting. The whole enchilada. This stuff isn't cheap. It's almost $500 for two professional microphones. The hosting site with our own convenient app is almost $500 as well. Just ask us and we’ll give you the full breakdown of what the costs are. The bare minimum goal is $3000.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Once the show is funded we can purchase all the equipment needed and start booking the interviews. The biggest challenge is scheduling. Luckily one of the great things about this show is that both the record labels and artists are excited about it too and have already agreed to help keep the show going.

If we aren't able to generate enough subscribers to pay for more video's we will have to get cut back on that idea until we can pay for that. Either way when we meet the Phase 1 goal there will be enough funding for 1 year of shows. Which with the contacts and the support of artists and labels will be sustainable for a long time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Woke up at 3 AM so excited for the next phase of the project to begin and wanted to thank each one of you personally. The preview episode is going to be released this weekend and I'm in the process of getting the t-shirts. I'll be contacting each of you about your rewards. You guys ROCK!!
Ben

updates.update_userinfo: Phase 1 is done! Just a couple days left.
Almost funded and a little sample on the way
updates.update_content:
I"m so excited! Within the past two weeks so many people have helped back this Kickstarter.  We are almost funded.  Just a couple hundred of dollars to go before we reach our fist goal when I distinctly remember launching this and thinking "Well, at least my mom will throw in for a t-shirt...I hope."  Thank you everyone for each and every gift.  And thank you for continuing to spread the word about this show and encouraging people to give and listen.

We borrowed some mics to interview Carrollton.  It was a great time.  But as they say you get what you pay for.  The mics ... well, they weren't spectacular.  We're working hard on editing it up so it's listenable.  It will likely be a sample show of what it will sound like versus a full episode.  All that means is we have to have them on again.  Either way you should have something to actually listen to in the next day or two.

Thanks again everyone!

Hi everyone!  Day 1 of the campaign is done and it exceeded my expectations.  With your help Sometimes There Is God is already 20% funded for Phase 1!  Over $600 was pledged for the project.  That's incredible to me!  Thank you so much.
There is still a long way to go to get to our ultimate goal.  Please continue to spread the word about the show and the kickstarter.
Again, thank you!

campaign.story:
IF YOU WANT TO SEE US ON TOUR, here’s how to pre-buy a concert ticket/backstage pass for $25 and FUND OUR FIRST TOUR EVER! 
1) Pledge $25 per ticket and we'll send you a laminated backstage pass autographed by the band with custom lanyard for each ticket you purchase. Simply add the price of your tickets onto whatever reward you choose.  
2) If we don't come to your city, you can return your beloved laminate for a full $25 refund.   
3) If you've still got questions, send us a message at Kickstarter and we'll either reply to you or post a response for all to see. 
4) Remember — you've already filled us with so much gratitude that our tour could arguably be fueled by love-gas. 
Stretch Goal #1 ($130K) = Domestic Bliss. If we can reach $130,000 total on Kickstarter, the plan is to kick off the tour with our special event Nashville concert and party on April 25th (see reward #10), then cover the USA in 30 days. Unless your home is in certain sections of Montana or the Dakotas, we hope to play a show within at least a 400 mile radius of wherever you live within the Continental U.S. And for those of you living in a major metropolis, we should be a whole lot closer — maybe even within walking distance.
We did a quick budget for a 20 city tour, and it breaks down like this: Transportation and fuel: $20,000 / Lodging and meals: $20,000 / Crew and equipment rentals: $20,000 / Keeping the home fires lit: $25,000 (Because some of us have kids. Who love to play with matches.) / Cheeto & Trail Mix allowance: $800 / Nightly cucumber mask (to keep our youthful glow): $1,200 / Insurance: $3,000 (Peter’s amazing sense of groove is insured by Lloyd’s of London.) / TOTAL COST: $90,000 
Stretch Goal #2 ($150K) = Break Out The Suit. If we hit $150,000... I will wear the On The Fritz suit live onstage each night during the encore. Although the reflective glare from this suit can cause temporary blindness, know this is going to hurt me a lot more than it hurts you.
Stretch Goal #3 ($170K) = Break Out The Dress. If we hit $170,000... I BREAK OUT THE DRESS for a second encore that includes “Lifeboat.” Those of you who have seen the “Lifeboat” video from 1985 know that this is a very bad idea, so please save my last shred of dignity and stop giving before we reach this particular goal. 
Stretch Goal #5 ($200K) = International Showtime. And what about those of you living abroad in places like Australia or New Zealand or the U.K. or the wilds of Europe? (Is Canada a foreign country?)This goal will allow us to fly economy class to your fair shores and play select international dates.
Stretch Goal #6 ($250K) = We Want To Play Latin America. Because we want to play Latin America. And even if Our Friends To The South don’t want to hear us, this would allow us the abilityto rent our own venues. So there.
Dear Backers-In-Waiting,
Why should I tempt fate and do another Kickstarter project when the last one ("Save Blue Like Jazz") was so wildly successful it can never be repeated?
Because before I became your 11th favorite filmmaker I was your 8th favorite recording artist, and I know you've missed me making music because you wrote and told me on Facebook and why would you lie?

And while it's true most recording artists get worse as they get older —usually much worse — isn't it at least statistically possible I may have gotten better?
Yes. And here's how:
1. Form a band with Jimmy Abegg, John Mark Painter and another longtime collaborator who was supposed to remain secret due to contractual restrictions but he/she enjoys drumming, surfing and running through photos cloaked in camo-net. Commence recording album's worth of suitable material.
2. Write lyrics culled from two decades of Life's Rich Pageant. Judge each line harshly. Refine until satisfied.
3. Discover to your surprise that your singing voice may have improved with age. Make note to record vocals asap before the onset of any potential throat-debilitating illness.
4. Return to Kickstarter community with outstretched palm. Include money back guarantee. Try not to reek of desperation.
And in anticipation of your frequently asked questions...
What will the music sound like? 
Your favorite color + your favorite candy + rock = the sound of STATPF 
Is there a deeper meaning behind the band moniker? 
"Steve Taylor" sings lead vocals and writes the lyrics / "And The Perfect Foil" write and record the music. And yes, those four words just happen to comprise an acronym of the band members' surnames. Coincidence? Yes, actually. 
We've been hearing about a new Steve Taylor album since the Clinton Administration. How do we know this is real?
I've played the demos for the neighbor kids. They will confirm that 1) It's real; and 2) It's weird when a grown man asks you to listen to his demos.
Will there be a tour?
It depends. Will you bring your friends?
Aren't you rich, Steve Taylor? Why don't you fund it yourself?
I was, in fact, reasonably well off at one time from a thriving music career that included writing songs you love, singing some of them, and producing a world-wide hit that rhymes with "Kiss Me." But five years into the New Millennium I developed a filmmaking habit that has required constant infusions of personal cash to the point where I can no longer fund anything beyond the occasional date night.
But don't you have a bank and/or rich friends who would loan you the money?
Yes, I do. And yes, they probably would. But thanks to certain principles laid out in a certain book given to me last year (authored by a certain Mr. Ramsey), I'd rather pre-sell the new album to all of you than borrow money to make it. And an even bigger reason is this: I have no idea how many people even care. Are there 100 of you? 1,000 of you? More? I can't think of a better platform than Kickstarter for finding out how many fans are interested in a new album, then expanding those plans accordingly, including whether or not it makes sense to go on tour. 
How will the money be spent?
Recording=$12,000 / Mixed and mastered by professionals=$10,000 / Artwork=$3,000 / Music Videos & P.R. to feed the promotional juggernaut=$7,000 / Estimated cost of backer incentives & Kickstarter fees=$8,000 / Grooming for the band photo=$1.50 / Grand Total = $40,001.50 
Will you go back to making movies after this?
That's the plan, God-willing. I've even got the screenplay I'm working on open in a separate window on my laptop. But making movies is hard—much harder than making music—and it takes me ten times as long (3-6 years) to make a movie as it takes me to record an album (3-6 months). Is my math accurate? Plus it's almost fifty times more expensive: $1-2mil for me to make a movie vs. $30-40K for me to record an album. And yes, I just did the mental math on that last statistic, which is why you can trust me with your money.
Your friend,
Steve Taylor
P.S. Some of you will want to know that the long-in-gestation Chagall Guevara live album is at the ready. My Guevarian bandmates felt it would be better to keep its release separate, so we hope to further press our luck by launching that campaign in January...
"Portrait of Ben Pearson" by Jimmy Abegg
This just-completed Jimmy Abegg original can be yours with a simple click o' the mouse.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Barring any unforeseen hubris (I just re-read Luke 12:16-21), we hope to pull this off with minimal delays or mishaps.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Steve Taylor has an urgent message from Father Time
updates.update_content: PLAY

…because if I start with an inside joke, you’re more likely to open it, right?
The fact that you’re getting this unrequested email is all your fault. You supported my past Kickstarter campaign(s), a deed that can never be undone.
Which means every 5-7 years — until one of us dies or you press unsubscribe — this will keep happening like those seven-year itches or cicadas or British septennial parliamentary elections back in the day.

Dear Enabling Angels,
Has it only been a year since the release of Goliath, an album two decades in the making? What if the follow-up was ready... NOW?!!

How was summer? Did you go swimming? Eat popsicles? Join a club that includes Vampire Weekend, The National, Bon Iver, Mumford & Sons, Wilco, Spoon, Death Cab, etc. by recording a live Daytrotter session? Or was that just us?
They even did a band portrait (and no, it's not a tarot card) to go along with the four-songs-live-in-the-studio-and-sounding-unlike-anything-we've-ever-done. Just another dream-come-true made possible by you, dear backer. Because we used the last of that Kickstarter money to buy the tank of gas that got us from Chicago to Rock Island, IL.

updates.update_userinfo: Free Download! More Tour Dates! Australian "Down Under" Photo!
updates.update_content:
So... we had a little hitch with iTunes, wherein they classified "A Conversation with Donald Miller & Steve Taylor (Plus Secret Hidden Track)" as an Album Only purchase on the Goliath Deluxe Edition. When we registered an official protest, we were informed that this was company policy due to the 15:28 length of the track. 
Therefore, because we don't want you repurchasing the entire album just so you can own this epic interview, you may now download the conversation and its not-so-secret hidden track HERE. For free! Because talk is cheap.

campaign.story:
2 Guys, 1 Boat, and a World of Adventure: A web series about two best friends traveling the world on a ship with 500 other college students. Fun and laughter are guaranteed, as these two live out their dreams and hopefully learn something along the way. In front of a camera.
We have been given the opportunity of a lifetime: To set sail around the world with 500 other college students. The program is called Semester at Sea (http://www.semesteratsea.org) and in a nutshell, consists of 500 college students on a cruise ship for two months.
Hi, we’re Riley and Dan, the nuts in the nutshell!
OK, sure…we’ll be earning 9 hours of school credit while on the ship, so it’s not all fun and games. But there will be fun and games. I mean, come on! It’s a big boat and when the boat pulls into port at various coastal towns around the world, our only job will be to explore and experience—to take it all in.
GENIUS MOMENT
A thought occurred to us: We need to document this. THIS IS KIND OF A BIG DEAL! We could do the typical iPhone videos and slideshows…but we can do better than that. Riley has been dabbling in filmmaking since he learned to hit a red record button and has been wanting to make a documentary but hasn’t been able to come up with a good subject. Ummm…ok. How about 2 GUYS ON A BOAT WITH A BUNCH OF COLLEGE STUDENTS?
HATCHING A PLAN
We want to take you with us. No, you can’t fit in our suitcases. Maybe some of you could…but there’s going to be some pretty foul-smelling clothes in there. What we hope to do is create a weekly web show called “Two Guys, One Boat, and a World of Adventure” which will feature our exploits and adventures from the past week. We’ll pack it all in there—embarrassing encounters with locals, awkward pauses, jumping off things into stuff (the “things” and “stuff” will change from week to week, but the concept is genius, right?), learning about life in other cultures, and a highlight music video at the end of the trip. We want to take you along for the ride, make you laugh, and maybe discover some new things about people and life along with us
THE CATCH
We’re college students. Read: we’re broke. It's hard enough to scratch enough money together for a taco, much less pay for a 2 month Semester at Sea AND fund a documentary on top of it. Besides deferring some of the travel costs associated with a semester abroad, we also need to purchase 2 GoPro Hero HD cameras (www.gopro.com) along with all the requisite mounting devices, several 32G SD memory cards, and travel cases. Plus, to really get the best footage around these countries, we need to take as many adventure excursions as possible (scuba diving, scooter rentals, bail money, etc). 
THE PLEA
Kickstarter is an all-or-nothing platform. We set a goal of $5,000, but if we don’t reach that goal, we get nothing. Zero. Zip. Nada. However, if we reach the goal, we also get to keep anything above the goal. So really, the goal is much higher but we set our Kickstarter goal lower than we actually need. We’ve come up with what we believe are some really funny and unique awards for you when you donate.
THE WRAP UP
We are two 19 year old guys living life to the fullest and living out our dreams. It’s all going to be good, clean fun because we’re good, clean, fun guys. We will take you with us as we travel to beautiful and amazing places, try new things, see amazing sites, and do a lot of laughing and learning in the process. Come with us as we visit Spain, Italy, Croatia, Greece, Turkey, Morocco, and Portugal. We will be updating you along the way every week, keeping you updated on the two month voyage. So help me go on this trip of a lifetime, and let me share in our experiences along the way. 2 Guys, 1 boat, and A World of Adventure.
